meanings.definition: The act of splitting or dividing something into two parts.
meanings.sent1: The cleavage of the cookie created two equal halves.
meanings.sent2: She used a knife to create a cleavage in the cake.
meanings.sent3: The cleavage of the argument led to a peaceful resolution.
meanings.sent4: His cleavage of the rope saved them from falling.
meanings.sent5: The cleavage of the rock revealed a hidden gem inside.

meanings.sent1: She wore a necklace that rested in her cleavage.
meanings.sent2: The actress adjusted her dress to show off her cleavage.
meanings.sent3: The spilled coffee landed right in her cleavage.
meanings.sent4: The sun cast a shadow in her cleavage, creating a heart shape.
meanings.sent5: Her cleavage was adorned with a delicate necklace.

meanings.definition: The tendency of minerals to break along parallel planes.
meanings.sent1: The geologist studied the cleavage of the diamond under a microscope.
meanings.sent2: The cleavage of the rock revealed its internal structure.
meanings.sent3: The cleavage of the mineral made it easier to extract.
meanings.sent4: The cleavage of the crystal was flawless and precise.
meanings.sent5: The cleavage of the gemstone sparkled in the light.
